name: Something From Your Lover
description:
SOMETHING FROM YOUR LOVER 

is a collaborative story-telling game around the tales of 7 boys, your soulmates from a different life. Play a generative intimate game of being, becoming, falling in love and it's different colors consequences and reveries. 

> 1 session plays (1-4 hours) for small groups wanting to tell romance together

> uses intuitive card image prompts 

> very RPG beginner friendly! (play-tested amongst beginners) 

> themed around songs.

~~~

1. A love like a shy tree crowns

2. A love that is an escape

3. A love born in a time of War

4. A love like worst accident

5. A love like full temptation

6. A love that re-discovers, nestles

7. A love full of consequences

 ---

Game-wise this explores a middle ground of CYOA short stories and almost a generative kind of "fanfic". I feel like RPGs that are said to simulate fanfic don't really capture the nebulous imagination and narrative experience of a reader rendering (1) a lover and projecting cohesively a (2) Y/N (Your Name)/ Main Character/self-insert that doesn't sacrifice the thematic structures that are underpinned in a love story.

Such as: Vulnerability, regret. Why we love really? or judgements (not long enough, too greedy etc) of the ones we had. The circumstances of our loving, and what it undoes in us when our hearts unfurl. This is what I hoped to capture in these stories and I hope you remember parts of your heart in playing them as well.

I hope you remember, these things from your Lover.

PS. let me know in the comments who calls you the most, how your play-thrus went.
